fields.title: Bayesian model comparison
fields.pointers:
* From a Bayesian standpoint, it's better to average predictions over many models than to select just one. This is known as  [Bayesian model averaging](bayesian_model_averaging) .
* Some general classes of methods for estimating Bayes factors include:
**  [sequential Monte Carlo](smc_partition_function)
**  [Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC)](mcmc_partition_function)
**  [variational Bayes](variational_bayes)
fields.summary: The framework of Bayesian model comparison evaluates probabilistic models based on the marginal likelihood, or the probability they assign a dataset with all the parameters marginalized out. The marginalization of model parameters implements a sort of "Occam's razor" effect. Marginal likelihoods can also be used to compute a posterior over model classes using Bayes' rule.
